# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here's a Julia function that wraps a string based on the given text width:
```julia
function wrap_string(text, text_width = 10)
    words = split(text, r'\s+'))
    wrapped_lines = []

    current_line = ""
    for word in words
        if !isempty(word) && (current_line * " ") + word > text_width
            # Wrap the line
            wrapped_lines += [current_line]
            current_line = word
        else
            current_line *= " " * word
        end
    end

    # Add the last line
    if !isempty(current_line)
        wrapped_lines += [current_line]
    end

    return join(wrapped_lines, "\n"))
end
```

Example usage:
```julia
text = """
Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet,
consectetur adipiscing elit.
"""

wrapped_text = wrap_string(text)
println(wrapped_text)
```
This will output the wrapped text with line breaks at the specified `text_width`.
